com.seamless.ers.interfaces.external.data
Class ClientContext

java.lang.Object
  com.seamless.ers.interfaces.external.data.ClientContext

public class ClientContext
extends java.lang.Object

Context is used to authenticate and authorize a specific client request but also to provide other request parameters.

Constructor Summary
ClientContext()
           
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getChannel()
          Channel of client sent request to the ClientWS, for example ClientWS-ATM, ClientWS-WEB.
 java.lang.String getClientComment()
          Comment to the request submitted by the client.
 java.lang.String getClientId()
          This is a unique id for the client, for example ClientWS.
 java.lang.String getClientReference()
          The client reference for the transaction, should be unique at least for the specific client id to be usable but the ERS will not check this when submitted.

          The client side timeout for the request is milliseconds (ms).
 PrincipalId getInitiatorPrincipalId()
          Principal ID of the principal that initiates the request.

getClientRequestTimeout

public long getClientRequestTimeout()
The client side timeout for the request is milliseconds (ms). If the server takes longer time than this to process the request it will attempt to abort or rollback the request.

Returns:
the clientRequestTimeout

setClientRequestTimeout

public void setClientRequestTimeout(long clientRequestTimeout)
The client side timeout for the request is milliseconds (ms). If the server takes longer time than this to process the request it will attempt to abort or rollback the request.

Parameters:
clientRequestTimeout - the clientRequestTimeout to set

getClientReference

public java.lang.String getClientReference()
The client reference for the transaction, should be unique at least for the specific client id to be usable but the ERS will not check this when submitted.

The maximum allowed length of this field is 32 characters.

Returns:
the clientReference

setClientReference

public void setClientReference(java.lang.String clientReference)
The client reference for the transaction, should be unique at least for the specific client id to be usable but the ERS will not check this when submitted.

The maximum allowed length of this field is 32 characters.

Parameters:
clientReference - the clientReference to set
